title: Ticket #5732: Allow more flexible command order within DAG files
description:
Just had a discussion about #5729 with Lauren, and in the course of this she mentioned that she didn't realize that most commands that reference a node must come after the node is defined.

For example, the following is not legal: 

  SCRIPT PRE A ...
  JOB A ...

We think this should probably be changed, to allow a "natural" ordering of certain commands: 

  JOB A
  PARENT A CHILD B
  SCRIPT PRE B ...
  JOB B ...
  SCRIPT POST B ...

I think the way to do this would be to go to a "two pass" parsing, where we parse JOB, SUBDAG EXTERNAL, and FINAL commands in the first pass, and everything else in the second pass.
